description: Ground ozone level detection dataset for predicting high ozone days. Contains meteorological measurements and ozone readings from Houston, Galveston, and Brazoria area, used for air quality forecasting.

original_source.creator: Kun Zhang, Wei Fan, XiaoJing Yuan
original_source.institution: Xavier University of Louisiana, IBM T.J. Watson Research, University of Houston
original_source.publication: Zhang, K., Fan, W. (2008). Forecasting skewed biased stochastic ozone days: analyses, solutions and beyond. Knowledge and Information Systems, 14(3), 299-326.

columns.name: Date
columns.semantic_description: Date of measurement - temporal identifier for the observation.

columns.name: WSR0
columns.semantic_description: Wind speed resultant at time 0 - combined wind speed measurement.

columns.name: WSR1
columns.semantic_description: Wind speed resultant at time 1 - subsequent wind measurement.

columns.name: WSR2
columns.semantic_description: Wind speed resultant at time 2 - wind speed progression.

columns.semantic_description: Wind speed resultant at time 5 - wind speed temporal data.

columns.semantic_description: Wind speed resultant at time 6 - wind measurement.

columns.semantic_description: Wind speed resultant at time 19 - wind speed observation.

columns.semantic_description: Wind speed resultant at time 21 - wind measurement.

columns.semantic_description: Wind speed resultant at time 23 - late night wind.

columns.name: WSR_PK
columns.semantic_description: Peak wind speed resultant - maximum wind speed of the day.

columns.name: WSR_AV
columns.semantic_description: Average wind speed resultant - daily mean wind speed.

columns.name: T_PK
columns.semantic_description: Peak temperature - maximum temperature of the day.

columns.name: T_AV
columns.semantic_description: Average temperature - daily mean temperature.

columns.name: T85
columns.semantic_description: Temperature at 850 hPa level - upper air temperature.

columns.name: RH85
columns.semantic_description: Relative humidity at 850 hPa - upper air moisture.

columns.name: U85
columns.semantic_description: U wind component at 850 hPa - east-west wind at altitude.

columns.name: V85
columns.semantic_description: V wind component at 850 hPa - north-south wind at altitude.

columns.name: HT85
columns.semantic_description: Geopotential height at 850 hPa - atmospheric pressure height.

columns.name: T70
columns.semantic_description: Temperature at 700 hPa level - mid-level atmospheric temperature.

columns.name: RH70
columns.semantic_description: Relative humidity at 700 hPa - mid-level moisture content.

columns.name: U70
columns.semantic_description: U wind component at 700 hPa - mid-level east-west wind.

columns.name: V70
columns.semantic_description: V wind component at 700 hPa - mid-level north-south wind.

columns.name: HT70
columns.semantic_description: Geopotential height at 700 hPa - mid-level pressure height.

columns.name: T50
columns.semantic_description: Temperature at 500 hPa level (~5500m) - upper atmospheric temperature.

columns.name: RH50
columns.semantic_description: Relative humidity at 500 hPa - upper air moisture content.

columns.name: U50
columns.semantic_description: U wind component at 500 hPa - upper level east-west wind.

columns.name: V50
columns.semantic_description: V wind component at 500 hPa - upper level north-south wind.

columns.name: HT50
columns.semantic_description: Geopotential height at 500 hPa - upper level pressure height.

columns.name: KI
columns.semantic_description: K-Index - atmospheric instability indicator for thunderstorm potential.

columns.name: TT
columns.semantic_description: T-Totals index - convective storm prediction parameter.

columns.name: SLP
columns.semantic_description: Sea level pressure - surface atmospheric pressure.

columns.name: SLP_
columns.semantic_description: Sea level pressure change from previous day - pressure tendency.

columns.name: Precp
columns.semantic_description: Precipitation amount - rainfall/moisture indicator.

columns.name: T_range
columns.semantic_description: Temperature range - difference between daily max and min temperature.

columns.name: P_range
columns.semantic_description: Pressure range - variation in atmospheric pressure.

columns.name: H_range
columns.semantic_description: Humidity range - variation in relative humidity.

columns.name: WSa
columns.semantic_description: Wind speed near sunrise (09-12 UTC) - morning wind conditions.

columns.name: WSp
columns.semantic_description: Wind speed mid-day (15-21 UTC) - afternoon wind conditions.

columns.name: Tmax
columns.semantic_description: Maximum temperature in degrees F - daily high temperature.

columns.name: Tb
columns.semantic_description: Base temperature (50Â°F) - threshold for net ozone production.

columns.name: SRd
columns.semantic_description: Solar radiation total for the day - photochemical reaction driver.

columns.name: Upwind
columns.semantic_description: Upwind ozone background level - transported ozone concentration.

columns.name: EmFactor
columns.semantic_description: Precursor emissions related factor - local pollution contribution.

columns.name: O3_prev
columns.semantic_description: Previous day ozone level - temporal dependency indicator.

columns.name: O3_local
columns.semantic_description: Local ozone measurement - current observation point.

target_classes.meaning: Normal ozone day - ozone levels below threshold
High ozone day - ozone levels exceed health standards

dataset_history: Collected from 1998 to 2004 in the Houston-Galveston-Brazoria area, a region with significant air quality challenges. Data supports Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) forecasting efforts. Research addressed the challenging problem of predicting rare high-ozone events with skewed class distribution.
inference_notes: Contains 2536 instances with highly imbalanced classes (~90% normal days, ~10% ozone days). Missing values require imputation using temporal averages. Meteorological features at multiple atmospheric levels capture complex ozone formation dynamics. Wind speed and temperature patterns are critical predictors. The dataset demonstrates challenges in forecasting rare environmental events with severe health impacts.
